decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly generating mana through spells like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond to cast a high storm count spell like Tendrils of Agony to finish the game. It uses card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm and Gitaxian Probe to find key combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Cabal Therapy. The deck also utilizes graveyard recursion with Past in Flames to allow for multiple casts of key spells in a single turn. It aims to win the game in one explosive turn.

This UWx Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful counterspells and removal to control the game, while also leveraging card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck includes efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Path to Exile, along with disruptive counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm. Additionally, it includes card selection and filtering tools such as Brainstorm and Ponder, as well as win conditions like Monastery Mentor and Council's Judgment. This deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast opponents through careful resource management and card advantage.

The deck focuses on utilizing disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth to slow down opponents while efficiently removing threats with Swords to Plowshares. Aether Vial helps put creatures into play quickly, while cards like Serra Avenger and Flickerwisp provide aggressive and disruptive options. Wasteland and Rishadan Port are used to disrupt opponents' mana bases, while Karakas serves as a versatile tool for dealing with problematic creatures. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure and disrupt opponents' game plans to secure victory.

This deck revolves around quickly generating mana and card advantage by playing multiple cheap Elves, untapping them with cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger, and drawing cards with Glimpse of Nature. The main goal is to ramp up to Craterhoof Behemoth or Natural Order for Craterhoof Behemoth to deal massive damage to the opponent in one turn. The deck also has access to various sideboard options to interact with and disrupt opponents' strategies.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creature cards such as Griselbrand and Chancellor of the Annex using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting, and then bringing them back into play for a powerful reanimation combo with cards like Animate Dead and Reanimate. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures early in the game, taking advantage of their powerful abilities to quickly close out the game. The deck utilizes a variety of fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual to ensure a quick and efficient reanimation strategy.

The deck aims to quickly generate a large board presence of Elves by utilizing Glimpse of Nature and Green Sun's Zenith to chain together powerful combos. By efficiently tutoring for key pieces like Wirewood Symbiote and Heritage Druid, the deck can generate massive amounts of mana and draw cards to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Craterhoof Behemoth provides a powerful finisher to close out the game. This combo-oriented strategy requires efficient sequencing and resource management to maximize the deck's potential.

The main concept of this Dark Depths combo deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create the 20/20 Marit Lage token. To achieve this, the deck heavily focuses on fast mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, along with ways to quickly search for combo pieces through Entomb and Living Wish. The deck also includes reanimation spells like Shallow Grave and Exhume to cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand. Overall, the deck aims to win the game with a powerful, hard-to-answer 20/20 creature.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Sanctum Prelate to tax your opponent's spells, and Stoneforge Mystic to search for powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice, you can control the pace of the game and gradually wear down your opponent. With a mix of disruption and threats, this deck aims to outmaneuver and overwhelm your opponent in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting, then bringing them back to the battlefield with spells like Animate Dead and Reanimate. This allows the player to cheat expensive creatures like Griselbrand and Elesh Norn into play early in the game, overwhelming their opponent with powerful threats. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Unmask and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect their own combo.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. It utilizes cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Stoneforge Mystic to slow down the opponent and search for powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice. It also has disruptive elements like Karakas and Phyrexian Revoker to control the board. The deck aims to control the game with its disruptive elements and close out the game quickly with its aggressive creatures and equipment.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler, while disrupting their game plan with disruptive spells like Wasteland, Spell Pierce, and Force of Will. The deck also aims to control the board with versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze, while digging for more threats and answers with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. By efficiently deploying threats and disruption, this Grixis Aggro deck looks to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and card advantage engines to control the game and out-value the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantages through cards like Baleful Strix, Snapcaster Mage, and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. The deck also includes a versatile suite of counterspells and removal spells to handle a variety of threats. The mana base is carefully curated to support the deck's color requirements and provide consistency in casting its spells.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay, and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana, the Last Hope and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It also utilizes powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to apply pressure on the opponent while providing card advantage. The deck aims to control the game by efficiently removing threats and generating card advantage, ultimately outvaluing the opponent and grinding them out for the win.

The main concept of this deck is to use the powerful Death's Shadow creature alongside cards like Street Wraith and Gurmag Angler to quickly establish a big threat on the board. The deck utilizes various spells like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember. Overall, the goal is to apply early pressure and use the aggressive nature of Death's Shadow to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build a board of elves, generate a lot of mana with Gaea's Cradle, and then use powerful spells like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith to combo out for a win. The deck aims to chain together multiple elf creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent in a single turn, often using cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Nettle Sentinel to generate additional value and advantage. Additionally, the inclusion of Craterhoof Behemoth provides a strong finisher to close out games.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy and generate advantage. It aims to assemble the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a powerful 20/20 Marit Lage token. Additionally, the deck can recur key lands with Life from the Loam and Punishing Fire to control the board and keep the opponent at bay. With a mix of land destruction, search, and recursion, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through a combination of resource denial and powerful threats.
